description:
There are several different tests failing here:

http://logs.openstack.org/79/101579/4/check/gate-nova-python26/990cd05/console.html

Checking on the ec2 failure shows it started on 6/23:

http://logstash.openstack.org/#

I'm guessing this is the change that caused the problem:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/077e3c770ebeebd037ce882863a6b5dcefd644cf
title: sqla 0.9.5 breaks the world

comments.content:
There are several different tests failing here:

http://logs.openstack.org/79/101579/4/check/gate-nova-python26/990cd05/console.html

Checking on the ec2 failure shows it started on 6/23:

http://logstash.openstack.org/#

I'm guessing this is the change that caused the problem:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/077e3c770ebeebd037ce882863a6b5dcefd644cf
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
FWIW this looked suspicious too but it merged a few days before the error started showing up:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/100382/
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
Dan Smith wasn't hitting this locally until he rebuilt his local tox and then started hitting it, so probably a dependency update, and looks like sqlalchemy 0.9.5 was released today:

https://pypi.python.org/pypi/SQLAlchemy/0.9.5
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
Change abandoned by Matt Riedemann (<email address hidden>) on branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/102002
Reason: It's something with sqlalchemy 0.9.5 which was released today.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Thinking it's something with this change: https://bitbucket.org/zzzeek/sqlalchemy/issue/3029

Given how the nova sqla.db.api code is doing joins, e.g.:

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#n1023
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
There is a change to global-requirements to ignore 0.9.5:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/102015/
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
Looks like there is something here that broke sqla:

https://bitbucket.org/zzzeek/sqlalchemy/issue/3060
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content: Here is the nova requirements update: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/102130/
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem
